text: {{Infobox settlement | name = District of Vila Real | population_note = | leader_name = | unit_pref = Metric | area_footnotes = | area_total_km2 = 4,328 | elevation_footnotes = | elevation_m = | population_footnotes = | population_total = 223,731 | population_as_of = | population_density_km2 = auto | population_demonym = | timezone1 = | leader_party = | utc_offset1 = | timezone1_DST = | utc_offset1_DST = | postal_code_type = | postal_code = | area_code_type = | area_code = | iso_code = PT-17 | website = | footnotes = | blank_name_sec1 = No. of parliamentary representatives | leader_title = | government_footnotes = | native_name = | subdivision_name = Portugal | native_name_lang = pt | settlement_type = District | image_skyline = | image_caption = | image_flag = | image_seal = | image_shield = VRL.png | image_map = LocalDistritoVilaReal.svg | map_caption = | coordinates = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_type1 = Region | seat = Vila Real | subdivision_name1 = Norte | subdivision_type2 = Historical province | subdivision_name2 = Trás-os-Montes e Alto Douro | subdivision_type3 = No. of municipalities | subdivision_name3 = 14 | subdivision_type4 = No. of parishes | subdivision_name4 = 268 | established_title = | established_date = | founder = | seat_type = Capital | blank_info_sec1 = 5 }} The District of Vila Real ( ) is a district of northern Portugal. It has an area of . The district is located east of Porto and north of the Douro River. It is bordering Galicia in the north and east, Braga District and Porto District in the west, Viseu District in the south and Bragança District in the east. == Municipalities == The district has 14 municipalities: * Alijó * Boticas * Chaves * Mesão Frio * Mondim de Basto * Montalegre * Murça * Peso da Régua * Ribeira de Pena * Sabrosa * Santa Marta de Penaguião * Valpaços * Vila Pouca de Aguiar * Vila Real
title: Vila Real District
